message.content:
cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.LG, cs.IT 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes quantized gossip algorithms for solving consensus and averaging problems on directed graphs, which are typical problems in distributed computing. 
2. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - The paper studies the convergence time of the proposed algorithms on directed graphs, which are commonly used to model social and information networks. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper investigates the shrinking time of the smallest interval that contains all states for the consensus algorithm and the decay time of a suitable Lyapunov function for the averaging algorithm, which are concepts related to systems and control. 
4. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper uses a Lyapunov function to analyze the convergence time of the averaging algorithm, which is a common technique in machine learning for analyzing the stability of learning algorithms. 
5. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper derives polynomial upper bounds on convergence time by considering the special case of complete graphs, which involves analyzing the hitting time of certain Markov chains, a concept related to information theory.
